text: I'm making a quick pickle for a grilled

Vietnamese sandwich and pickle
vegetables are a foundation of lots of

a sharp knife to thinly slice a cucumber
and four radishes now you may be
thinking that this sounds like rabbit
food so far but we are going to get to
the other stuff soon and for these
carrots
how beautiful are these use a peeler
it's easier than a knife certainly and
you want thin ribbon so that they're not
too hard
leave the top on and it acts as a handle
and our pickling liquid very simple salt
about 1/2 a teaspoon 2 teaspoons of good
old granulated sugar to balance the
acidity and rice wine vinegar it has a
really nice gentle flavor I want about a
quarter cup here that looks good that
goes right over the vegetables and give
this a good toss you can do this ahead
and chill it in the fridge until you're
ready to use it all right I think we're
ready for fish red snapper is a firm
textured saltwater fish has a nice mild
flavor and drizzle with a little oil and
generously season with salt and pepper
these things always take more seasoning
than you think and don't forget about
the other side I have the grill already
preheating that's important because if
you try to put this down onto a cold
grill it's going to stick so really be
sure that grill is smoking hot and again
more salt and pepper okay this is ready
for the fire ok I'm going to use the
hand trick that feels nice and hot so I
know it's ready and very important here
be sure to oil the grates just before
you put the fish down don't boil them
ahead of time because the grates can
actually become tacky and sticky if the
oil sit you're gonna get some smoke here
but that's okay that's a good sign that
it's nice and hot
and on goes the fish as tempting as it
may be do not touch the fish let it get

release itself and be easy to flip I

looking close you

you'll run into trouble just like that
and two to three minutes more on the

these buns here these happen in a flash
you can see that the flesh is pulling
